answers.answer: There are normally two options, bypass surgery and placing stents.What the best option is for your father depends on many factors.A few factors that I can think of are:-your father's physique-the skills and options the hospital can offer-the exact position, number and extent of the blockages-the impact of his diabetes on surgeryThere are for sure much more factors that need to be taken into account for making a decision on preferred treatment.His cardiologist has the knowledge and also knows the details on your fathers condition.You really need to discuss the options with his cardiologist.

question: My father is 70 years old. Having BP diabetes.On 5/8/16 faced an attack.Angiography done on 1/9/16.Left circumflex proximal 50%OM proximal 80 %RCA plaque dirtal 90 %RPDA plaquePLV 90 %Please advise for best option for unblocking.Thanking you
title: 3 valves blocked need help in ayurveda
